## Model selection using information criteria

Idea: find a compromise between model fit and model complexity.

AIC:
\begin{align*}
\text{AIC} = - 2 \log (\mathcal{L}^\text{HHMM}(\theta,(\theta^{*(i)})_i\mid (X_t)_t,((X^*_{t,t^*})_{t^*})_t)) + 2 p,
\end{align*}
where $p$ denotes the number of parameters.

BIC:
\begin{align*}
\text{BIC} = - 2 \log (\mathcal{L}^\text{HHMM}(\theta,(\theta^{*(i)})_i\mid (X_t)_t,((X^*_{t,t^*})_{t^*})_t)) + \log(T T^*) p,
\end{align*}
where $T T^*$ is the number of observations.

## Challanges associated with model selection

HHMMs (as HMMs) favor models with too many states. Pragmatic selection of the number of states. Cite @poh17.
